subject: p15659181
History: History of left flank pain. Please evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: The heart size is normal. The hilar and mediastinal contours are normal. Obscuration of the right heart border would ordinarily suggest right middle lobe pneumonia, but there is no corresponding abnormality on the lateral view, and lungs are otherwise clear. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: Because the abnormal appearance of the right middle lobe is seen only on the frontal view, if clinical findings warrant suspicion of early pneumonia, follow up chest radiographs should be obtained.
